channel.title: New patching tutorial : live sampling fun (beat, arp and granular)
channel.description:
This is more or less the follow up of my last patching video, but this time I go a bit further. As usual, it's long, messy, and not very exciting, but that's life ...
https://youtu.be/Dj1J_qaLNOA

item.title: New patching tutorial : live sampling fun (beat, arp and granular)
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

It always feels better with analogue inputs, and for starting point it's quite precise. You can also do it with two inputs (midi or gpio) one with a wide range, and one much more precise. The advantage of midi being saveble and recallable with presets (if needed)

Read full topic
item.source: New patching tutorial : live sampling fun (beat, arp and granular)

item.title: New patching tutorial : live sampling fun (beat, arp and granular)
item.dc:creator: @mokomo
item.description:
@mokomo wrote:

Superb tutorial Mytas! thank you.
For control of the granularizer and sample start points would you recommend analog pots rather than midi? Just wondering if the analog control significantly helps with precision

Read full topic
